metadata.titel_preek: Lent and Holy Week: Psalm 51 and Psalm 19

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human condition of universal sin and self-deception to justify the ungodly through the substitutionary death of Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically in the person of Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has shown us a great thing.
Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
the salvation of each and every one of us

zender.identificatie: The Holy God/The Reality of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the holiness of God, who has the absolute right to make demands and render judgments
while we were still sinners, Christ died for us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver (the unrighteous) rather than the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: bearing in his own body the storm of the wrath of God
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (Christ's humanity/sacrifice).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the one who grants 'insight' or 'repentance'.

tekstueel_bewijs: the storm of the wrath of God against sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is treated not as a mistake but as a condition that requires the death of God's Son to nullify.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and 'unflinching' self-knowledge.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly states that the knowledge of grace precedes the confession of sin (Program 1 enables Program 2).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has shown us a great thing.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
God sees you as you really are, and he loves you.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We throw ourselves on his mercy.
We do not need to lie to ourselves.
The psalmist demonstrated that he has learned to see sin as God sees it.

voorbeelden: the most honest assessment... that we can possibly offer
Our temptation will be... to try to squirm off the hook.
The recognition of sin comes as the psalmist is confronted...
God is truly able to do away with sin.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) to save the 'Incompetent' human subject. Human 'Knowing' (Savoir) is a gift of the Spirit, not a prerequisite for God's action.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false security of ~S2 (denial of sin) to the crushing weight of S2 (wrath), then reveals S1 (grace) as that which has already absorbed S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the 'sentence' (S2) upon himself, allowing the sinner to move from ~S1 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as a 'storm of wrath' and 'cosmic evil'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. It avoids the 'If-Then' conditional trap and places the agency of salvation entirely on God's side.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The psalmist demonstrated that he has learned to see sin as God sees it.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself.
bearing in his own body the storm of the wrath of God against sin

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David/The Psalmist is used as a 'Receiver' of insight rather than a hero to be imitated by effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God reveals sin to the Psalmist.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'exhausting charade' of performance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Self-Inventory' of Lent to the 'Substitution' of Good Friday is seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit grants the 'Savoir' (insight) to see sin truly.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an offense against the 'Author of all goodness' that requires death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The hearer is never asked to 'do' in order to 'get'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'insight' is always framed as a gift rather than a human achievement.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It uses the 'I' of the Psalms to lead the hearer into a 'Thou' encounter with God's mercy.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the use of Tolkien/Solzhenitsyn as 'illustrations', Greimassian analysis shows they function as actants defining the 'Opponent' (Sin) as universal.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of 'Hyssop' or 'Clean heart' to show how the text functions as a narrative of Subject-substitution.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'insight' of repentance is actually a modal competence (Savoir) granted by the Sender (God) to the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
